description: This course focuses on principles of pharmacology and care of the hospitalized adult. Topics include pain management, sleep and rest, and sensory perceptual alterations. Students apply the nursing process to the care of adults, with emphasis on the elderly. Using a holistic perspective, students collect and analyze information related to an individual's health status. Students begin to develop the professional role of caregiver and patient advocate. Taken concurrently with Nursing 302, 304, 306. Offered annually in the fall semester.
name: Adult Health I
notes: Nursing 308 Adult Health I will also meet T-F 700 a.m.-12:30 p.m. in HH 215.
